link.synopsis: Modern Stone Age family the Flintstones hit the big screen in this live-action version of the classic cartoon. Fred (John Goodman) helps Barney (Rick Moranis) adopt a child. Barney sees an opportunity to repay him when Slate Mining tests its employees to find a new executive. But no good deed goes unpunished. Rosie O'Donnell, Elizabeth Perkins, Halle Berry and Elizabeth Taylor also star in this colorful family comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Honey, I Blew Up the Kid
The New Adventures of Pippi Longstocking
The Land Before Time III: The Time of the Great Giving
T-Rex: Back to the Cretaceous: IMAX

link.synopsis: In this sequel to the hilarious comedy Grumpy Old Men, a family wedding reignites the ancient feud between next-door neighbors and fishing buddies John and Max (Jack Lemmon and Walter Matthau). Meanwhile, a sultry Italian divorcée (Sophia Loren) opens a restaurant at the local bait shop, alarming the locals who worry she'll scare the fish away. But she's less interested in seafood than she is in cooking up a hot time with Max.
link.title: synopsis
A Guide for the Married Man
City Slickers II: The Legend of Curly's Gold

link.synopsis: Katharine Hepburn and Spencer Tracy's seventh pairing solidifies the on-screen charisma of the two legendary actors. Pat Pemberton (Hepburn), an athletic prodigy who's a natural in any sport except dating, meets her match in Mike Conovan (Tracy), a feisty promoter who takes her under his wing. Together, they set the sports world on its ear and find that opposites attract in director George Cukor's Oscar-nominated romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: A Russian submarine runs aground near a small New England town, and it's up to Lt. Rozanov (Alan Arkin) as the Russians' second-in-command to covertly secure a towboat to avoid an international confrontation. When he hooks up with residents such as Walt Whittaker (Carl Reiner) and the police chief (Brian Keith), all hell breaks loose. This classic comedy earned three Oscar nominations, including one for Best Picture.

link.synopsis: In Nazi-occupied Czechoslovakia, Josef and Marie Cizek grudgingly agree to shelter David, a Jewish concentration camp escapee, in their tiny apartment. When Josef takes a job with a Nazi collaborator to ease suspicion, mayhem consumes the household. Filled with pungent humor and universal truths about the fragility of the human condition, director Jan Hrebejk's poignant film skirts a fine line between comedy and tragedy.
link.title: synopsis
Blessed Is the Match: The Life and Death of Hannah Senesh
The Boy in the Striped Pajamas

link.synopsis: Eddie Murphy talks to the animals once again in this lovable family comedy. This time, it's up to the good doctor to defend the habitat of a lone female bear, Ava (voiced by Lisa Kudrow), and introduce her to a suitable (if intellectually challenged) mate (voiced by Steve Zahn). Raven-Symone and Kristen Wilson co-star in this sequel that features the voices of Isaac Hayes, Frankie Muniz, David Cross, Mandy Moore, Jamie Kennedy and Andy Dick.
link.title: synopsis
Garfield: A Tail of Two Kitties
Homeward Bound 2: Lost in San Francisco
Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore

link.synopsis: Number Five is still alive in this sequel to the popular 1980s cybernetic comedy. Now going by the handle "Johnny" Five, the friendly robot reunites with his creator, Ben Jahrvi (Fisher Stevens), who now earns a living making toys in New York. But complications ensue when Jahrvi's new business partner (Michael McKean) turns out to be part of a gang of bank robbers. Jahrvi and Five promptly join forces to foil the thieves' big heist.

link.synopsis: Richard Pryor takes the stage in this film that's equal parts performance and documentary. Three years after the drug-related accident that nearly killed him, a now clean and sober Pryor weighs in on heroin, meeting Ronald Reagan, the South and more. Edgier, reflective and more mature, the comedian also deals with some unwelcome hecklers in the crowd at New Orleans's Saenger Theater and proves his comedy skills are as sharp as ever.

link.synopsis: In this dark comedy, Wanda (Holly Hunter) and Verna (Elizabeth Ruscio) both want their daughters to join the high school cheerleading squad. Since Verna's child seems most likely to win, Wanda decides to hire a hit man to kill either Verna or her daughter -- or both. When the story gets out, Wanda's trial turns into a media circus. Michael Ritchie directs this film, which is based on real-life events in Houston.

A Woman Scorned: The Betty Broderick Story
Perfect Husband: The Laci Peterson Story

link.synopsis: Ample teen Tracy Turnblad (Ricki Lake) wants nothing more than to be on the hip local TV dance program, "The Corny Collins Show" -- and when her dream comes true, her lively moves and bubbly personality meet with unexpected popularity. But after witnessing firsthand the terrible state of race relations in 1960s Baltimore, Turnblad becomes an outspoken advocate for desegregation. John Waters's comedy inspired the Broadway musical of the same name.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Lindsay Lohan stars in this sparkling comedy, based on author Dyan Sheldon's novel of the same name, about an avowed New York City teenager whose social life is uprooted when her family relocates to the suburbs of New Jersey. Determined to become popular at her school, she jostles with the reigning Queen Bee for supremacy. Does she stand a chance? Adam Garcia, Glenne Headly and Alison Pill co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Bring It On: All or Nothing

link.synopsis: Hapless scientist Wayne Szalinski (Rick Moranis) apparently didn't learn his lesson when he accidentally reduced his children (Amy O'Neill and Robert Oliveri) to microscopic size in the hit comedy Honey, I Shrunk the Kids. In this sequel, he's got a similar problem -- but in reverse -- when his invention turns his 2-year-old son Adam (Daniel and Joshua Shalikar) into a giant toddler who makes the city of Las Vegas his personal playground.
link.title: synopsis
And You Thought Your Parents Were Weird
The Neverending Story 3: Escape From Fantasia

link.synopsis: Resort employee Jenny (Amanda Bynes) can't believe her luck when a rock star she idolizes, Jason Masters (Chris Carmack), checks in for a vacation. Dreaming of a way she can spend some time alone with him, Jenny fantasizes that they're both stranded on a deserted island. Her dream does come true -- almost. Jonathan Bennett, Lance Bass, Fred Willard and Jamie-Lynn DiScala also star in this romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
What I Like About You: Season 1
The Prince & Me 2: The Royal Wedding
From Justin to Kelly: The Tale of Two American Idols

link.synopsis: Rock musician Sting stars in this black comedy as Fledge, a butler who begins work at the English estate of boorish scientist Sir Hugo Coal (Alan Bates) and immediately disrupts the household by seducing Coal's wife, Lady Harriet (Theresa Russell). But when the poetry-writing beau (Steven Mackintosh) of the Coal's daughter (Lena Heady) goes missing, Fledge's affairs aren't the only secrets that come to light. John-Paul Davidson directs.
link.title: synopsis
The Favor, the Watch and the Very Big Fish
The Lonely Passion of Judith Hearne
Agatha Christie's Evil Under the Sun

link.synopsis: Bored housewife Sarah Sullivan (Laura Clifton) decides to add some spice to her life by having a tryst with her shrink (Don Cass). What's more, she's hidden cameras inside her house that allow her voyeuristic paramour to watch as she has sex with her spouse (Sean Corrigan). Before you can say "kinky," Sarah embroils the good doctor in a scheme to bump off hubby and collect his sizeable inheritance in this unsettling dark comedy.

link.synopsis: The Disney Channel's hit series about identical twins Zack (Dylan Sprouse) and Cody (Cole Sprouse) -- who live with their mother in a cool suite at the upscale Tipton Hotel in Boston -- features barrels of fun for the entire family. Although they're only 12, the brothers are living large and in charge, and each day brings new adventures when you have a hotel as your hangout. Extras include a trivia game plus outrageous outtakes and bloopers.

link.synopsis: In this made-for-TV thriller, a young doctor becomes suspicious when healthy patients in her hospital start falling into comas after routine procedures. She soon uncovers something sinister afoot -- and discovers that she can trust no one.

link.synopsis: Bored by his summer at grandma's house, teenager Kenny (Wes Stern) writes letters to two buddies, Mike (Ricky Kelman) and Tommy (Wink Roberts), back home. Having heard men talk about Rosie's, a nearby bordello, Kenny boasts to his pals that he's visited the place. Naturally, this intrigues the two, who decide to visit Kenny and see Rosie's for themselves. Jacqueline Bisset co-stars in this amusing coming-of-age comedy.

link.synopsis: Two inmates plan to break out of prison, warn a pal about a scam and then get back behind bars in Up the River, part of a John Ford comedy double bill. In When Willie Comes Marching Home, a young man (Dan Dailey) enlists after Pearl Harbor hoping to see combat. But Willie becomes a laughingstock when he's assigned to a new military base in his hometown, and in a bid to finally win some respect, he volunteers for a dangerous mission.

link.synopsis: Ron Mann's documentary explores how comic books were elevated to pop art and bore witness to cultural phenomena with the help of legendary creators such as Robert Crumb, Will Eisner, William Gaines, Bill Griffith and Stan Lee. The film traces the medium from its ultrapatriotic beginnings -- with pages filled with superheroes fighting for truth, justice and the American way -- and shows how it evolved into sophisticated, complicated, readable art.

link.synopsis: Inspired by the book by Robert Littell, this historical miniseries follows rookie CIA agent Jack McCauliffe (Chris O'Donnell) as he trains under the watchful eye of mentor Harvey Torriti (Alfred Molina), aka the Sorcerer, during the Cold War. Meanwhile, fellow agent James Angleton (Michael Keaton), aka Mother, is driven to a near-breakdown by the hunt for a mole in the agency. Alessandro Nivola and Natascha McElhone co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Benedict Arnold: A Question of Honor
CIA: Shocking Stories Behind the Headlines
Anne of Green Gables: The Continuing Story

link.synopsis: The third installment in this popular comedy series finds young Alex Pruitt (Alex D. Linz) home alone with the chicken pox and a stolen microchip. Turns out, that due to a mix-up among spies, Alex was given the toy car containing the computer chip. Now the spies must find a way to get the chip back. When Alex tries to tell his parents he's in trouble, they don't believe him, leaving the boy to defend himself.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Two down-on-their-luck brothers (Nathan Lane and Lee Evans) inherit a run-down mansion that turns out to be worth millions. They can sell it and pocket a fortune, but first they have to evict its diminutive tenant: a mouse with no intention of leaving. Slapstick humor abounds -- along with a great cameo by Christopher Walken as a crazed exterminator -- in this zany family comedy from director Gore Verbinski (The Pirates of the Caribbean trilogy).
link.title: synopsis
Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat

link.synopsis: Get ready for some wholesome family fun with this 1976 Disney comedy about the California Atoms, an inept, last-place football team that turns its luck around with the help of their new star player -- a football-kicking mule named Gus! The villainous competition attempts to kidnap Gus, with slapstick results. Ed Asner, Don Knotts, Tim Conway, Dick Van Patten, Bob Crane and Tom Bosley fill out the star-studded cast.

The Strongest Man in the World
Now You See Him, Now You Don't

link.synopsis: Triple-threat comedian, screenwriter and actor Dave Chappelle takes the stage with his own blend of observant, laid-back comedy in this 60-minute stand-up special that originally aired on HBO in 2000. Never one to shy away from hot topics, Chappelle takes on the police, racism, Sesame Street, the government and all other comers, cementing his well-earned reputation as one of America's funniest funnymen.

link.synopsis: When Nashawn Wade (Kevin Hart) wins $100 million in a lawsuit against an airline, he decides to launch his own, dubbed N.W.A., complete with an onboard dance club and casino, bootylicious flight attendants and Snoop Dogg as the pilot. But things get out of hand on the maiden flight when a white family headed by Tom Arnold is accidentally rerouted to fly on N.W.A. D.L. Hughley, Mo'Nique and Method Man co-star in this ghettofabulous comedy.

link.synopsis: This comedy follows a small fishing town in Quebec that's facing tough times as the economy continues to take a hit. The townspeople are thrilled when a major company chooses their locale to build a factory; trouble is, the factory will be built only if the town can convince a full-time doctor to move there. So, a local man (Raymond Bouchard) organizes a no-holds-barred crusade to bring in a big city doctor (David Boutin).
link.title: synopsis
The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill but Came Down a Mountain

link.synopsis: Novelist Jane Austen's 1813 masterpiece is delightfully updated to modern times in this romantic comedy about college student Elizabeth Bennet (Kam Heskin), who decides she has no time for amour because all she wants is to become a famous author. But Elizabeth didn't anticipate the surprising nature of love, and she soon finds herself torn between the rakish Jack Wickam (Henry Maguire) and the practical Will Darcy (Orlando Seale).
link.title: synopsis
The Prince & Me 3: A Royal Honeymoon
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise

link.synopsis: Pull up your tube socks for this coming-of-age comedy centered on 1970s roller-skate jams. A boy known as "X" (Bow Wow) dominates the local roller rink with his friends. But when the crew's home base goes out of business, they have to look for another hangout. At the Sweetwater Roller Rink across town, the friends are blown away by the skaters and pretty girls they meet, and they pick up a few new tricks.
link.title: synopsis
8 Wheels and Some Soul Brotha' Music
This is Roller Skating & Other Odd Rarities
I Could Never Be Your Woman

link.synopsis: With a strong work ethic and technical savvy that allowed him to quickly build a huge legion of fans, Boston native Dane Cook emerged as one of America's most popular stand-up comedians early in the 21st century. Here, he shows off his stand-up comedy roots in his first-ever solo HBO concert in his hometown. He riffs on subjects like the therapeutic power of a good lie, the value of cheating in a relationship and seeing your father's genitals.

link.synopsis: After a night of passion with a seductive customer, shy teen delivery boy Jeremy (Robert Sean Leonard) starts looking pale, hating garlic and thirsting for blood. Mentored by the mysterious Modoc (Rene Auberjonois), the budding bloodsucker slowly gets the hang of his new lifestyle. David Warner co-stars as the ruthless vampire-hunting professor Leopold McCarthy in this smartly written, underrated 1980s teen comedy.

link.synopsis: Stop-motion comedy, parody and anarchy are rolled into one in this demented series created for the Adult Swim cartoon block. The Robot Chicken himself is an unfortunate creature rescued by a mad scientist and forced to watch television nonstop. The zany animated content runs the gamut from movie satires to fake ads, most of it intended to mock pop culture in general and mainstream television and film in particular.

link.synopsis: Inspired by a fake movie trailer shown at the 2009 BET Awards, this cross-dressing crime comedy stars Martin Lawrence and Jamie Foxx as Sheneneh and Wanda, two of the baddest and ugliest female armed robbers America has ever faced. Reprising characters created for the series "In Living Color," Lawrence and Foxx tear up the California landscape with large weapons, bad taste and hilarious behavior. Halle Berry is also along for the ride.

The offbeat comedy stars Sandra Bernhard, Ornella Mui, Bai Ling and Peter Stormare and features music by ex-Velvet Underground member John Cale.

But in the dog-eat-dog world of comedy, the need to succeed could doom their friendship. The talented supporting cast includes John Goodman, Damon Wayans, Kim Greist and Mark Rydell.

link.synopsis: A horny high school student (Roddy McDowall) puts his telepathic powers to good use when he employs them to romance a stuck-up co-ed (Tuesday Weld). What's this Prince Charming's secret? He makes all her dreams come true in this comedy that oscillates between light humor and stuff that's a tad darker. Based on Al Hine's novel lampooning Southern California's youth culture. Like, totally, fer sure!

link.synopsis: When widowed Ella Connors (Jane Fonda) gets pressured to sell her failing cattle farm to her unscrupulous and powerful ex-lover, Jacob Ewing (Jason Robards), she enlists the aid of her antagonistic neighbor, Frank Athearn (James Caan). As Ella and Frank fight stampedes, betrayal and sabotage to rope enough livestock to pay the ranch's debts, they begin feeling a growing affection for each other in this gritty Western directed by Alan J. Pakula.
link.title: synopsis
The Return of a Man Called Horse
Harry and Walter Go to New York

link.synopsis: In this cutting-edge drama from award-winning New Zealand filmmaker Garth Maxwell, washed-up singer Katie struggles to create a new life for herself while coping with yearning admirer Eddie and living with her best friend, Stephen. Stephen is in love with sexually confused ex-hustler Mark, while, uninhibited band members Fig and Sally yearn for success -- and each other! Six friends. Three kinds of love.

The Boy with the Sun in His Eyes
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

link.synopsis: Just days before the nuptials are to take place, Capt. "Bulldog" Drummond (John Howard) is forced to postpone his wedding again when his beautiful fiancée, Phyllis (Louise Campbell), is kidnapped by dastardly siblings Mikhail (J. Carroll Naish) and Erena (Helen Freeman). Seems that several years ago, Bulldog put Erena's husband behind bars, and now, the villainous vixen is out for a little vengeance.

link.synopsis: Returning home after a lengthy business trip, Frank (Stephen McHattie) discovers his girlfriend, singer Janie (Susan George), now works at a new resort hotel and has taken up with the owner (John Osborne). Furious, the disturbed Frank goes on a shooting rampage and takes Janie hostage. A tense standoff ensues in this gripping drama, which co-stars Oliver Reed as a police lieutenant who responds to the crisis on his last day before retirement.

link.synopsis: Peter Cottontail (voiced by SpongeBob SquarePants' Tom Kenny) gets an updated look in this animated re-creation of the stop-motion classic from 1971. While Peter is preparing for Easter, his enemies January Irontail (former Bond Roger Moore) and Jackie Frost (SNL's Molly Shannon) plot to thwart the bunny's plans and take away his holiday cheer. Christopher Lloyd also lends his voice in this musical adventure.

link.synopsis: Karen Black, Lawrence Hilton-Jacobs and Erik Estrada star in this gritty tale of a narcotics bust that deteriorates into a bloody urban war. After plans for the perfect drug bust go awry, an undercover cop is plunged into a brutal battle between crack-obsessed assassins and double-crossing gangsters. Making thrifty and inventive use of stock footage, director Jason Holt punctuates his crime drama with savage action and a surrealistic love scene.

Other songs include "I Worship You" by Steve Crawford, "I'd Rather Have Jesus" from FGBCF Women's Mass Choir, "Living Testimony" by Mighty Clouds of Joy and Doug Williams and "Paul's Testimony" by the Christianaires.

But when a gangster on the lam follows him to town, Freckles finds his homecoming full of chaos. Freckles gets mixed up in the crook's plot, finds himself accused of murder, and loses his sweetheart, Jane (Gale Storm), to a con man. Now, Freckles must straighten out the mishaps and win back the girl.

link.synopsis: Bewitching, passionate and beautiful, Esmeralda (Maria Rojo) is happily married -- to five husbands! But just as she's about to marry groom No. 6, she's charged with polygamy. She reveals her reasons for marrying each husband to stern Judge Solorio (Claudio Obregon), who -- like Esmeralda's spouses -- is no match for her charms. Meanwhile, her husbands conspire to break her out of jail, and feminists demonstrate in her defense.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Based on Nobel Prize winner Isaac Bashevis Singer's writings, this whimsical tale from director Jan Schütte follows charmer Max Kohn (Otto Tausig), an 80-year-old author who escapes life's doldrums by losing himself in his imagination's colorful creations. Elizabeth Peña portrays Max's daffy cleaning lady, while Rhea Perlman, Barbara Hershey and Tovah Feldshuh play the disparate women in his romantic orbit.
link.title: synopsis
Blood and Wine: A Brazilian Story

link.synopsis: April Valley is home to many rabbits, but only one can be Chief Easter Bunny. With his charm and spirit, Peter Cottontail (voiced by Casey Kasem) is a shoo-in for the job -- if he delivers the most eggs on the appointed morning. It won't be easy, though, when evil January Q. Irontail (the inimitable Vincent Price) causes Peter to sleep through his alarm in this stop-motion classic narrated by kindly dye maker Seymour S. Sassafras (Danny Kaye).

link.synopsis: After winning the heavyweight championship, boxer Duke Foster (Allan Lane) quits the ring to marry socialite Susan Corbin (Heather Angel). When his businessman father-in-law Arnold (Frederick Burton) loses his fortune, Duke returns to the ring to raise money for him. Susan is furious that Duke is breaking his promise never to box again, and the stakes get even higher when a crooked promoter orders him to take a dive ... or else.

link.synopsis: While working day and night on a gory slasher series, mild-mannered film editor Ed (Johan Rudebeck) starts having horrific hallucinations, which slowly drive him insane. Once he's completely lost his mind, Ed turns into a crazed killer who cannot be stopped. In this extremely graphic and violent dark comedy, tranquilizers, knives and even bullets prove incapable of ending Evil Ed's bloody reign of terror.

Blood Feast 2: All U Can Eat
H6: Diary of a Serial Killer
Henry: Portrait of a Serial Killer

link.synopsis: In this made-for-cable ensemble comedy, a hodgepodge of friends, rivals and oddballs gather in Chicago for their 10-year high school reunion, with sanctimonious class president Robert Levitt (David Schwimmer) serving as host. Among the attendees are a wild jokester (Lara Flynn Boyle), a delusional vixen (Teri Hatcher) and a self-help sage (Heidi Stillman). Cameos by the likes of Molly Ringwald and Liev Schreiber add to the fun.
link.title: synopsis
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay

link.synopsis: Writer-director Vladimir Rif steers this madcap Cold War-era sex comedy about a cramped Moscow apartment that doubles as a home to 31 strangers who are forced to become roommates by government decree. To drive the neighbors -- and her mother (Shelley Winters) -- a little batty, Vera (Lee Taylor-Allan) pretends to be a lesbian. But her mother would much rather she dated her drunkard boss (Paul Sorvino).
link.title: synopsis
The Happy Hooker Goes to Washington

link.synopsis: When Mike (Mark Kassen), a struggling writer, sees the gorgeous Lola (Ara Celi) dancing at a Los Angeles nightclub, he's instantly smitten. Lola, who's just moved to California from Guadalajara, Mexico, aspires to be a dancer. The two hit it off, but the new relationship is based on lies: Each thinks the other is wealthy. As the lies grow, the confusion mounts in this romantic comedy. Can their bond survive the truth?

link.synopsis: The stars of the Logo stand-up comedy series "Wisecrack" hit the road and head to Hollywood for the Outlaugh Comedy Festival, America's first queer comedy festival, hosted by Margaret Cho. Jason Stuart starts off the season with his hilarious rants.
link.title: synopsis
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Suzanne Westenhoefer: A Bottom on Top
I'm the One That I Want

link.synopsis: Woody Allen's a two-bit Manhattan theatrical agent with a client list only a freak show promoter could love. His "ace in the hole," though, is sonorous crooner Lou Canova (Nick Apollo Forte). To assuage Lou's titanic ego (and keep him as a client), Woody must escort the singer's mistress, Tina (Mia Farrow), to Lou's club dates. One mishap follows another in this gem of a comedy.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.synopsis: With Fred playing a psychoanalyst and Ginger as his besotted patient, this Astaire-Rogers vehicle is as much screwball comedy as it is musical. When patient falls in love with doctor, that doctor -- who's best friends with said patient's fiancé -- hypnotizes the patient to convince her otherwise. Much silliness and a smattering of dance numbers ensue (including one set to Irving Berlin's Oscar-nominated "Change Partners and Dance with Me").
link.title: synopsis
The Story of Vernon & Irene Castle
Rhythm on the Range / Rhythm on the River: Double Feature
The Wolf Man / Frankenstein Meets the Wolf Man

link.synopsis: Struggling mystery writer Larry (Billy Crystal) is exasperated by his mediocre student, Owen (Danny DeVito), who has imagined a gentlemen's agreement to kill Larry's devious ex-wife if Larry offs Owen's domineering, overbearing mother (Anne Ramsey) in this classic black comedy. Larry begrudgingly attempts to hold up his end of the bargain after Owen carries out his, but scene-stealing Momma proves to be an extremely difficult target.
link.title: synopsis

link.title: City Slickers II: The Legend of Curly's Gold
See No Evil, Hear No Evil

link.synopsis: A frazzled widow tells her psychiatrist the unbelievable circumstances that made her a multimillionaire in this star-studded comedy. In a series of flashbacks, Louisa (Shirley MacLaine) recalls her four very different husbands (Dick Van Dyke, Paul Newman, Robert Mitchum and Gene Kelly) -- all of whom she married for companionship, and all of whom died rich, but prematurely, from ironically bizarre circumstances. Dean Martin also stars.
link.title: synopsis
How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life / Who Was That Lady?
A Guide for the Married Man
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
I Love You, Alice B. Toklas!
How to Stuff a Wild Bikini

link.synopsis: This third outing for the unambitious kings of stoner comedy -- Cheech Marin and Tommy Chong -- concerns their latest enterprise: selling ice cream from a truck. (But, of course, they're delivering more than just good humor to their customers.)
link.title: synopsis
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Cheech Marin and Friends: Live from South Beach
The Union: The Business Behind Getting High
The Nine Lives of Fritz the Cat

link.synopsis: This clever comedy takes you through one hellaciously funny day in the life of small-time independent filmmaker Nick Reve (Steve Buscemi), who has one goal: to realize his artistic vision within the confines of an extremely low budget. Unfortunately, Nick keeps encountering a maddening number of obstacles, both real and imagined, that keep him from getting what he wants out of life. Catherine Keener, Dermot Mulroney and James LeGros co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Love and Death on Long Island
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story

link.synopsis: George Kimball (Rock Hudson) is a sweet husband, a respectable businessman … and a hopeless hypochondriac. He overhears his physician discussing another patient's terminal diagnosis and mistakes it for his own, prompting him to find a suitable husband for his wife, Judy (Doris Day). George's error leads to a whole sequence of hilarious mix-ups. Doris Day sings the title song in this Hudson-Day comedy classic.
link.title: synopsis
By the Light of the Silvery Moon
A Guide for the Married Man
How to Stuff a Wild Bikini

link.synopsis: Mr. Wilson's (Walter Matthau) ever-present annoyance comes in the form of one mischievous kid named Dennis (Mason Gamble). But he'll need Dennis's tricks to uncover a collection of gold coins that go missing when a shady drifter named Switchblade Sam (Christopher Lloyd) comes to town. John Hughes (Home Alone) penned this comedy based on Hank Ketcham's television hit and long-running comic strip. Lea Thompson co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
Dennis the Menace: Trouble, Trouble Everywhere!
Honey, I Blew Up the Kid
Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat

link.synopsis: Widow Abby McClure (Doris Day) manages lumberjacks by day and looks after her three sons by night. One day, she meets nice-guy Jake Iverson (Brian Keith), a widower with a daughter. They fall in love, get married and try to blend their two families into one functioning unit. Howard Morris directs this family comedy co-starring Barbara Hershey, George Carlin, Alice Ghostley, Jamie Farr and Pat Carroll.
link.title: synopsis
Suppose They Gave a War and Nobody Came?
By the Light of the Silvery Moon
A Guide for the Married Man
The Adventures of Ma & Pa Kettle: Vol. 1

link.synopsis: A young journalist investigates the mysterious demise of beloved comedy duo Lanny Morris and Vince Collins two decades after their split. When a beautiful girl was found dead in their hotel room, their longtime friendship ended.
link.title: synopsis
When Did You Last See Your Father?
A Guide to Recognizing Your Saints

link.synopsis: Actor-comedian Mike Epps (Roll Bounce, The Honeymooners), who simultaneously launched his own HBO series "Unsuccessful Thug" while preparing for the lead in a Richard Pryor biopic, nails another career milestone with his first solo stand-up show. Delivering a full hour of hardcore comedy in this hilarious HBS special, Epps makes no apologies for his inappropriate behavior -- after all, it made him a star.
link.title: synopsis
Mike Epps Presents: Live from Club Nokia
Mike Epps: Under Rated & Never Faded
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 1

link.synopsis: Five disparate kids (Dyllan Christopher, Gina Mantegna, Quinn Shephard, Tyler James Williams and Brett Kelly) snowed in at the airport on Christmas Eve learn some lessons about friendship when they launch a bid to get back to their families and outsmart a disgruntled airport official (Lewis Black) who wants to keep them grounded. Wilmer Valderrama, Teri Garr and Jessica Walter co-star in this quirky teen comedy.
link.title: synopsis
R.L. Stine's The Haunting Hour: Don't Think About It
The Neverending Story 3: Escape From Fantasia
Judy Moody and the Not Bummer Summer
Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Rodrick Rules
3 Ninjas: High Noon at Mega Mountain

link.synopsis: Lt. Jim Dangle (Thomas Lennon) and the rest of the gang from the Washoe County Sheriff's Department are transported from landlocked Reno to the sunny shores of Miami in this big-screen version of Comedy Central's cop spoof. While attending a police convention at the height of spring break, the Reno cops prove their crime-fighting abilities are as sharp as ever (meaning not very!) after a biological attack occurs and they race to save the day.
link.title: synopsis
Aqua Teen Hunger Force Colon Movie Film for Theaters
Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery

link.synopsis: When her new husband turns out to be a philandering cheat, elementary school teacher Kayla King (Sherial Mckinney) vows to unravel the mystery of men and their bad behavior -- and soon discovers that she can actually hear men's thoughts. But Kayla's new ability teaches her that she should be careful what she wishes for. Kazeem Molake directs this romantic comedy that co-stars Ayo Sorrells, Dylan Mooney and Deja Lewis Smith.
link.title: synopsis
Diary of a Tired Black Man
Love and Other Four Letter Words
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed 2
A Good Day to Be Black & Sexy
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend
Love Beat the Hell Outta Me
Jessica Sinclaire's Confessions of a Lonely Wife
Breaking Up Is Hard to Do
Lord, All Men Can't Be Dogs

link.synopsis: Drafted into the Air Force, country bumpkin Will Stockdale (Andy Griffith) drives Sgt. Orville King (Myron McCormick) crazy with his overly friendly, dim-witted style. But Will bonds with fellow private Ben (Nick Adams), and the two try for a transfer to the infantry in this classic comedy. Meanwhile, King attempts to keep Will out of his hair by appointing him Permanent Latrine Orderly. Don Knotts appears as a nervous dexterity tester.
link.title: synopsis
The Wackiest Ship in the Army
The Shakiest Gun in the West / The Love God?: Double Feature
Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House

I Was a Male War Bride
Good Soldier Schweik 2: Beg to Report, Sir
The Charge of the Light Brigade
Arbuckle & Keaton: The Original Comique Paramount Shorts 1917-1920: Vol. 1

link.synopsis: An all-star cast shines in this indie comedy about a typical night in 10 bars across Los Angeles, where former cop Francine becomes entangled with a group of oddballs, including a murderous dentist, an ambitious club hostess and a regretful father.
link.title: synopsis
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: My Little Chickadee
The Boy with the Sun in His Eyes
Across the Line: The Exodus of Charlie Wright

link.synopsis: Humdrum ranch life in late-1950s British Columbia gets all shook up when California hepcat Butch (John Wildman) roars in one day in a snazzy red convertible, then turns adoring 12-year-old cousin Sandy (Margaret Langrick) on to rock and roll, chewing gum and teenage angst. In director Sandy Wilson's autobiographical coming-of-age comedy, it isn't long before Butch has the whole town abuzz, especially when his own hidden past catches up with him.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: The Just for Laughs Montreal International Comedy Festival is one of the most prestigious -- and hilarious -- comedy events in the world, drawing an amazing assortment of comedic talent. In this collection of stand-up performances, comedians take the stage for a memorable evening of laughs, featuring Mitch Hedberg, Dave Attell, Dane Cook, Lewis Black, Jim Breuer, Maria Bramford, Harland Williams, Mitch Fatel and Sean Cullen.

Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 3: Launching Pad

title.regular: Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 2: On the Edge

link.synopsis: As a young lad sharing a central London apartment with his mother, bored young Percy Boon (Richard Attenborough) has to find kicks wherever he can. When his quest for fun inadvertently makes him an accomplice to murder, he lands in jail. But he and his mum are loved by their neighbors, who take up a collection to bail Percy out while the real culprits sit in jail! Alastair Sim and Fay Compton also star in this droll British comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Strange Affair of Uncle Harry
The Man in the White Suit

link.synopsis: The complete works of Shakespeare -- 37 plays -- are frenetically performed by The Reduced Shakespeare Company in 90 minutes, including a hilarious send-up of "Romeo and Juliet," "Hamlet" with sock puppets and "Titus Andronicus" as a cooking show. The trio breezes through all 17 comedies at once to allow more time for lampooning his tragedies and historical plays. Adam Long, Reed Martin and Austin Tichenor star.
link.title: synopsis
William Shakespeare: A Life of Drama
P.D.Q. Bach in Houston: We Have a Problem
A Bit of Fry and Laurie
Shakespeare Comedies: As You Like It

Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back

title.regular: The Complete Works of William Shakespeare (Abridged)

link.synopsis: Based on John Nichol's book set in a tiny New Mexican town, Robert Redford's comedy-drama pits the little guys against big development. When a local resort owner wants to expand, farmer Joe (Chick Vennera) takes a stand. The eccentric locals divide on the issue, but organized action mixed with a little magic unites them to fight for their rights. John Heard, Christopher Walken, Sonia Braga, Ruben Blades, Daniel Stern and Melanie Griffith costar.
link.title: synopsis
The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill but Came Down a Mountain
Born on the Fourth of July
Man Against the Mob: The Chinatown Murders

link.synopsis: In this classic crime drama directed by Ramsey Harrington, Ronald Howard (son of legendary actor Leslie Howard) plays an ex-convict who's built a respectable post-prison life for himself as an engineer, but discovers that a past is a hard thing to shake. When old "friends" contact the former prisoner, it's not long before the gone-straight baddie finds himself being blackmailed into taking part in a major jewelry theft.
link.title: synopsis
Agatha Christie's Evil Under the Sun

link.synopsis: Swingin' '60s tunes highlight this fun comedy about Mike Samson (Tommy Kirk), the athletic but arrogant leader of the sand-and-surf set, who resorts to a complicated and unusual scheme in order to woo the girl of his dreams, sophisticated Delilah Dawes (Deborah Walley). When Delilah spurns his passes, Mike invents a shy, intellectual twin brother, Herbert, who's everything that he isn't. But can he keep up the charade and his plan from backfiring?
link.title: synopsis
Dr. Goldfoot and the Bikini Machine
Dr. Goldfoot and the Girl Bombs
How to Stuff a Wild Bikini
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
Don't Tell Mom the Babysitter's Dead

link.synopsis: An insurance examiner whose company assigns him to investigate the use of papelles -- fake travel insurance papers required by the strict government -- falls into a fiery affair with the woman responsible for creating them.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Join Zack and Cody (Dylan and Cole Sprouse) and the rest of the Suite Life gang for another round of hilarious high jinks and madcap misadventures in this four-episode collection of the popular Disney Channel series. The school's production of "High School Musical" is shaping up to be a disaster when, despite her apparent lack of talent, London's (Brenda Song) awarded the starring role over Maddie (Ashley Tisdale).

link.synopsis: The same year they co-starred in Alfred Hitchcock's Vertigo, James Stewart and Kim Novak teamed up for this popular screen version of a hit Broadway comedy. Novak is a witch in Greenwich Village, who casts a love spell on already-engaged Stewart. The spell works, but Novak wants Stewart's love the old-fashioned way -- with magic of the romantic variety. Jack Lemmon, Ernie Kovacs and Elsa Lanchester also lend their support.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.synopsis: Television news reporter James Russell (Charlie Sheen) exposes small-time criminal Franklin Hatchett (Chris Tucker) for a story, which gets Hatchett arrested. While in transit to prison, Hatchett gets cuffed to jewel thief Raymond Villard (Gérard Ismaël). In an escape attempt, Villard's cronies blow up the prisoner-transport vehicle and kill two cops. Hatchett then seeks Russell's help to prove his innocence in this action-filled comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

link.synopsis: Set on the last day of 1981, 200 Cigarettes is a manic romantic comedy that follows a group of loquacious, chain-smoking twentysomethings seeking love and happiness as they converge for a blowout party in New York City's East Village. A cab driver (Dave Chappelle) provides the link between the disparate groups who seek to overcome personal drama to avoid being alone when the clock strikes midnight.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: This touching, exciting and beautiful film tells the story of Savannah, a delightful runaway 6-year-old, who is thrown together with two escaped convicts, Alvie and Boots, in a crazy comedy of errors.
link.title: synopsis
Kayla: A Cry in the Wilderness
Old Yeller / Savage Sam: Double Feature
